thread.title: 8 Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone
thread.title_full: 8 Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone

author: Lestere E. Johnson
title: 8 Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone
text:
IN Science & Technology ON 01 Feb, 2017 8 Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone Share on twitter Follow Us On 
If your phone is your precious baby, then you shouldn't be negligible towards it. You should be very careful while dealing with your smartest baby. Unfortunately, many of you perhaps don't treat it as well as you should. 
Find out the things that you might be doing wrong: 8 Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone 754 396 iPhone Ways You Are Ruining Your iPhone #1 Cleaning It With Household Products 
It can be tempting to use Windex to clean the screen, but there are static-free cleaning products made specifically for your mobile phone. #2 Letting Storage Space Max Out 
"Out-of-sight, out-of-mind" is the typical thought process adopted by many people who download a lot of apps and then don't delete them when they are not in use. #3 Activating Push Notifications 
Are you one of those people who just needs to be notified of every single new thing that comes up from all of the apps you've downloaded? This can be a detriment to your battery and the phone itself. #4 Using Damaged Power Cables 
It's really easy to plug your phone in on the nightstand right before you sleep for eight hours. Overcharging can ruin the battery, and it only takes about 30 minutes to get a full charge. #6 Leaving It On Constantly via 
It may look like your phone goes to sleep when the screen goes black, but leaving your phone on all of the time can overheat the device, causing system failures. Turn it off every once in a while and go outside. #7 Using Cheap Power Cords via 
When you are desperate for a new cord, do you look towards your local gas station for a replacement? Although it may seem like your phone company wants you to buy their products for selfish reasons, third-party chords can cause overheating. #8 Ignoring Updates 
Constant updates can be really annoying, especially when you want to get some screentime in. Still, regularly updating your operating system can fix system bugs and security vulnerabilities. Are you careful enough while dealing with your phone? others like
